alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 2:33AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall during the past six hours remains possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Surry. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 AM EDT, Monday evening and early this morning, heavy rainfall fell across much of Surry county, but especially the western portions. Minor flooding is ongoing or remains possible within the advisory areas. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall is expected early this morning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Brushy Fork, Bull Creek, Ararat River, Big Creek, Beaver Creek and Beaverdam Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Elkin... Fairview... Flat Rock... Dobson... Bottom... Mountain Park... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
